title: TC001-User Registration with Valid Details
description: Verify that a new user can register successfully using valid email and password credentials via Supabase Authentication.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to the registration page at /register.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/register', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Input valid full name, email, phone number, and password in the registration form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input full name in the registration form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test User')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid email address in the registration form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input phone number in the registration form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('+919876543210')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid password in the registration form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[4]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        # -> Submit the registration form by clicking the 'Create Account' button.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Create Account' button to submit the registration form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Clear the email field and input a new unique email address, then submit the registration form again.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear the email field to input a new unique email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input a new unique email address for registration
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('uniqueuser123@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Create Account' button to submit the registration form with new email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Verify that the user is redirected to the profile or login page and confirm the user record is saved with 'customer' role.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Sign in to your account').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The task goal was to verify that a new user can register successfully using valid email and password credentials via Supabase Authentication. However, the last action of navigating to the registration page at '/register' failed due to a timeout error. Specifically, the error message indicates that the page navigation to 'http://localhost:3000/register' exceeded the 10-second timeout limit while waiting for the page to load. This could be caused by several factors, such as the server not running, the URL being incorrect, or network issues. To resolve this, ensure that the server is up and running, the URL is correct, and that there are no network connectivity issues.

title: TC002-User Login with Correct Credentials
description: Validate that an existing user can login with correct email and password, and session is persisted.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to login page by clicking the Login link
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the Login link to go to login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Enter registered email and correct password
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Enter registered email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Enter correct password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button to submit login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Retry login by clearing inputs and re-entering credentials, then clicking Sign In again to check if login completes.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear email input
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear password input
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-enter registered email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-enter correct password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button again to retry login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Login Successful! Welcome to your dashboard').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: User login was not successful and session persistence could not be verified as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to validate that an existing user can log in with the correct email and password, and that the session is persisted. However, the last action, which involved clicking the 'Login' link to navigate to the login page, failed due to a timeout error. 

### Analysis:
1. **Task Goal**: Ensure the user can log in successfully and maintain a session.
2. **Last Action**: Clicking the 'Login' link.
3. **Error**: The click action on the 'Login' link exceeded the timeout limit of 5000ms, indicating that the action could not be completed in the expected time frame.

### Explanation of the Error:
The error message indicates that while the element was found and was visible, enabled, and stable, the click action did not trigger the expected navigation to the login page within the allotted time. This could be due to several reasons:
- **Page Load Issues**: The page may not have fully loaded or there may be a delay in the navigation process.
- **JavaScript Execution**: There might be JavaScript on the page that is preventing the navigation from completing as expected.
- **Element Overlap**: Another element could be overlapping the 'Login' link, preventing the click from being registered properly.

To resolve this issue, consider increasing the timeout duration, checking for any overlapping elements, or ensuring that the page is fully loaded before attempting the click action again.

title: TC003-User Login with Incorrect Credentials
description: Ensure login fails gracefully with invalid email or password and appropriate error messages are shown.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to login page by clicking the Login link.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the Login link to go to the login page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Enter invalid email and password, then click Sign In.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Enter invalid email in email input field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('invalid@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Enter incorrect password in password input field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('wrongpassword')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button to attempt login with invalid credentials.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Invalid email or password. Please check your credentials.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to ensure that the login process fails gracefully when invalid credentials are provided, and that appropriate error messages are displayed. However, the last action of clicking the 'Login' link to navigate to the login page did not succeed due to a timeout error. 

### Analysis:
1. **Task Goal**: Ensure that the login fails gracefully with invalid credentials and shows error messages.
2. **Last Action**: Attempted to click the 'Login' link to navigate to the login page.
3. **Error**: The click action timed out after 5000ms, indicating that the system was unable to complete the action within the expected time frame.

### Explanation of the Error:
The error message indicates that the locator for the 'Login' link was resolved correctly, and the element was visible and stable. However, the click action did not complete successfully within the allotted time. This could be due to several reasons:
- **Page Load Issues**: The page may not have fully loaded, causing delays in the click action.
- **JavaScript Interference**: There might be JavaScript on the page that is preventing the click from being processed correctly.
- **Element Overlap**: Another element could be overlapping the 'Login' link, preventing the click from registering.

To resolve this issue, consider increasing the timeout duration, ensuring the page is fully loaded before attempting the click, or checking for any overlapping elements that might be interfering with the click action.

title: TC004-Admin Role Authentication and Access
description: Verify admin user can login successfully and has access to admin dashboard features unique to their role.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the Login link to go to the login page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the Login link to navigate to the login page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input admin email and password, then click Sign In to attempt login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email in the email field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin password in the password field.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button to submit login form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to navigate manually to a known admin dashboard route to verify if admin access is possible.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/admin/dashboard', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Try to find any other admin dashboard or admin-specific links on the site or in the UI to verify admin access and dashboard features.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, await page.evaluate('() => window.innerHeight'))
        

        # -> Click on the 'Admin' button in the top right corner to check if it reveals any admin-specific options or dashboard access.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Admin' button in the top right corner to check for admin-specific options or dashboard access.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on the 'Admin Panel' link in the admin dropdown menu to attempt accessing the admin dashboard or admin features.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Admin Panel' link in the admin dropdown menu to access admin dashboard or features.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/div/div/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Verify restricted admin routes are only accessible by admin users by attempting to access a restricted admin route.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/admin/users', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Verify restricted admin routes are only accessible by admin users by attempting to access a restricted admin route as a non-admin user or checking access control.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/logout', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Navigate to the home page to complete the test and finalize the session.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Go Home' button to navigate to the home page and complete the test.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Admin').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Admin Panel').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Your trusted destination for premium quality textiles since 1995. We bring you the finest fabrics from across India.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to verify that the admin user can successfully log in and access the admin dashboard features. However, the last action, which involved clicking the Login link, failed due to a timeout error. The error message indicates that the click action on the Login link exceeded the 5000ms timeout limit. 

This could have occurred for several reasons:
1. **Element Not Responding**: Although the element was visible and stable, it may not have been responsive to the click action, possibly due to overlapping elements or JavaScript issues preventing the click from being registered.
2. **Navigation Delay**: The page may have been slow to respond or navigate after the click, causing the timeout to trigger before the action could complete.
3. **Dynamic Content**: If the page content is dynamically loaded, the element might not have been fully ready for interaction even though it appeared visible.

To resolve this issue, consider increasing the timeout duration, ensuring no other elements are obstructing the click, or checking for any JavaScript errors that might be affecting the page's functionality.

title: TC005-Browse Product Catalog with Filtering and Search
description: Ensure users can browse, search, and filter products by categories, sizes, colors, and see correct variant details including stock.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Open product listing page by clicking on 'Shop Men' button to start browsing products.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Shop Men' button to open product listing page for men's products
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section/div[6]/div/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try clicking the 'Men' category link in the 'Shop by Category' section to open the men's product listing page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Men' category link in 'Shop by Category' section to open men's product listing page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section[3]/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Apply filters for category, size, and color to test filtering functionality.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Shirts' category filter to filter products by Shirts
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[3]/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on size 'S' filter to filter products by size Small
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[4]/aside/div/div[6]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Apply size filter 'S' and color filter 'Blue' to test combined filtering functionality.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on size filter 'S' to filter products by size Small
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[4]/aside/div/div[6]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on color filter 'Blue' to filter products by Blue color
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[4]/aside/div/div[4]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Exclusive Limited Edition Unicorn Pajamas').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test plan execution has failed because the product listing and filtering did not update correctly, or the product details page did not show accurate variant details including stock.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC006-Add, Update Quantity, Remove, and Clear Shopping Cart
description: Test full client-side shopping cart functionality including adding multiple product variants, updating quantities, removing items, and clearing cart.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)

            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Men' category to view products and add variants to cart
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section[3]/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Add multiple product variants to the cart from the visible products.

        # -> Click 'Add to Cart' button to add the selected product variant to the cart.

        # Click 'Add to Cart' button to add 'Test Product' size M quantity 1 to cart
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Add another product variant to the cart from the 'You May Also Like' section or navigate back to add different variants.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Premium Linen Shirt' from 'You May Also Like' to add another product variant
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Add to Cart' button to add 'Premium Linen Shirt' size M quantity 1 to the cart.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Add to Cart' button for 'Premium Linen Shirt' size M quantity 1
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div/div[2]/button[3]/img').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Add to Cart' button to add 'Premium Linen Shirt' size M quantity 1 to the cart.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Add to Cart' button for 'Premium Linen Shirt' size M quantity 1
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Cart Updated Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test plan execution failed: Full client-side shopping cart functionality test failed including adding multiple product variants, updating quantities, removing items, and clearing cart.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to test the full client-side shopping cart functionality, specifically by adding product variants from the 'Men' category. However, the last action of clicking on the 'Men' category link failed due to a timeout error. The error message indicates that the click action exceeded the 5000ms timeout limit, even though the element was visible and stable at the time of the click attempt. 

This issue could be caused by several factors:
1. **Navigation Delay**: After the click action, the page may have taken longer than expected to navigate, causing the timeout.
2. **JavaScript Execution**: There might be JavaScript on the page that delays the navigation or modifies the DOM after the click, leading to the timeout.
3. **Element State**: Although the element was visible, it might not have been fully interactive or ready for the click action due to ongoing processes on the page.

To resolve this, consider increasing the timeout duration or implementing a wait for navigation after the click action to ensure the page is ready before proceeding.

title: TC007-Checkout Flow and WhatsApp Order Integration
description: Validate checkout process collecting required customer details and successfully triggering WhatsApp order message with correct order summary.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
 
        # -> Add products to cart by navigating to a product category and selecting a product.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section/div[6]/div/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Retry clicking on 'Shop Men' or try clicking on 'Men' category from 'Shop by Category' section.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section[3]/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Add a product to the cart by clicking on a product and then adding it to cart.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[4]/div/div[2]/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Add to Cart' button to add the product to the cart.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'View Cart' to proceed to the cart/checkout page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Proceed to Checkout' to go to the checkout page and fill in customer information.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill in customer information fields: Full Name, Phone, Address Line 1, City, State, Pincode.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('John Doe')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('9876543210')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123, Textile Market, Ring Road')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div[3]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Surat')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div[3]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Gujarat')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('395002')
        

        # -> Click the 'Order via WhatsApp' button to trigger the WhatsApp order message and verify the message content.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=� *New Order - Naveen Textiles* � *Order ID:* NT-MIYKHN7W2GZ � *Customer:* John Doe � *Phone:* 9876543210 � *Delivery Address:* 123, Textile Market, Ring Road, Surat, Gujarat - 395002 � *Items:* • Premium Linen Shirt (M, White) x1 - ₹1499 � *Total:* ₹1499 � *Payment:* Cash on Delivery Please confirm this order. �').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC008-Order Status Updates and Invoice Generation by Admin
description: Test that admin can update order statuses, trigger invoice generation, and that changes reflect appropriately on both admin dashboard and user order history.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on Login to go to login page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on Login link to go to login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input admin email and password, then click Sign In.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button to login as admin
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Retry login by inputting admin credentials again and clicking Sign In.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Re-input admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button again to retry login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to navigate to admin order management page directly or check if there is an alternative login or access method.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/admin/orders', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Generate invoice for the updated order by clicking the Invoice button for the same order.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Invoice button for the first order to generate invoice
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/table/tbody/tr/td[7]/div/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Login as the user who placed the order (John Doe) to verify order history and invoice visibility.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3000/logout', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Click on Login link in header to navigate to login page for user login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Login link in header to go to login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Go Home' button to navigate back to homepage and then try to access login page properly.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Go Home button to navigate back to homepage
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on Login link in header to navigate to login page for user login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Login link in header to go to login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Order Status Updated Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The test plan execution failed to verify that admin can update order statuses, trigger invoice generation, and that changes reflect appropriately on both admin dashboard and user order history.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to ensure that the admin can update order statuses and trigger invoice generation, with changes reflecting on both the admin dashboard and user order history. However, the last action attempted was to click on the 'Login' link to navigate to the login page, which failed due to a timeout error. 

### Analysis:
1. **Task Goal**: Verify that order status updates and invoice generation work correctly.
2. **Last Action**: Clicking the 'Login' link.
3. **Error**: The click action on the 'Login' link timed out after 5000ms, indicating that the expected navigation did not occur.

### Explanation of the Error:
The error message indicates that the click action was attempted on the 'Login' link, but the action did not complete successfully within the allotted time. The locator for the 'Login' link was resolved correctly, and the element was visible and stable, but the click action did not trigger the expected navigation. This could be due to several reasons:
- **JavaScript Errors**: There may be JavaScript errors on the page preventing the click event from being processed.
- **Event Listeners**: The click event might not be properly handled by the application, causing the navigation to fail.
- **Network Issues**: If the application relies on network requests to complete the navigation, any delays or failures in those requests could lead to a timeout.

### Next Steps:
- Check the browser console for any JavaScript errors that may have occurred during the click action.
- Ensure that the event listeners for the 'Login' link are functioning correctly.
- Investigate any network issues that may be affecting the navigation process.

        # Input offer description for percentage discount
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Get 15% off on all products during holidays')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input coupon code for percentage discount
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('HOLIDAY15')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input discount percentage as 15
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[4]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('15')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input minimum order value as 1000
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[5]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('1000')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input max discount as 500
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[5]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('500')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid from date
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[6]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('2025-12-09')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid till date
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[6]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('2025-12-31')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input usage limit as 100
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[7]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('100')
        

        # -> Click 'Create Offer' button to save the percentage discount offer.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Offer' button to save the percentage discount offer
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div[4]/div/form/div[9]/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click 'Create Offer' button to start creating the fixed amount discount offer.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Offer' button to create a new offer
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/main/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Exclusive Buy One Get One Free Offer').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test plan execution failed: Admins could not create offers with different discount types (percentage, fixed, BOGO), or users could not apply valid coupons with correct discounts during checkout.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
The task goal was to verify that admins can create offers and users can apply valid coupons during checkout. The last action attempted was to click on the Login link to access the login page for admin authentication. However, this action failed due to a timeout error, indicating that the click action could not be completed within the specified time limit of 5000 milliseconds.

### Analysis:
1. **Task Goal**: Ensure that admins can log in to create offers and users can apply coupons.
2. **Last Action**: Clicking the Login link.
3. **Error**: The click action timed out, which means the system was unable to navigate to the login page as expected.

### Explanation of the Error:
The error occurred because, although the element was visible and stable, the system could not complete the click action within the allotted time. This could be due to several reasons:
- **Page Load Issues**: The page may not have fully loaded, causing delays in the click action.
- **JavaScript Interference**: There might be JavaScript on the page that is preventing the click from triggering the navigation.
- **Element Overlap**: Another element could be overlapping the Login link, preventing the click from being registered.

To resolve this issue, consider increasing the timeout duration, ensuring the page is fully loaded before attempting the click, or checking for any overlapping elements that might be interfering with the click action.

title: TC010-Admin CRUD Operations for Products, Users, and Offers
description: Test that the admin can create, read, update, and delete products, user accounts, and promotional offers without errors in the admin dashboard.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the Login link to go to the login page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the Login link to navigate to the login page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/div/div/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input admin email and password, then click Sign In.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@naveentextiles.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@123')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click Sign In button to login as admin
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Retry login by clicking the Sign In button again to see if it proceeds.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Retry clicking Sign In button to attempt login again
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Admin Dashboard Access Granted').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test plan execution failed: Admin CRUD operations on products, user accounts, and promotional offers could not be completed successfully in the admin dashboard.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError: The task goal was to ensure that the admin can navigate to the login page by clicking the Login link. However, the last action of clicking the Login link failed due to a timeout error. The error message indicates that the click action exceeded the 5000ms timeout limit, even though the element was found to be visible, enabled, and stable. This suggests that while the element was present, there may have been an issue with the page's response time or a potential overlay preventing the click from being registered properly. To resolve this, consider increasing the timeout duration or checking for any overlays or modals that might be obstructing the click action.
